Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on freedom of speech and expression, which are protected under the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.
Granting ACMA the power to control and penalize misinformation and disinformation is a breach of international human rights agreements.
The bill could lead to censorship and the suppression of dissenting opinions, creating a totalitarian regime.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are vague and subjective, making it difficult to enforce fairly.
The legislation could lead to abuse of power by ACMA, with severe penalties for individuals and platforms.
Historical examples, such as the Thalidomide case, demonstrate the importance of allowing open discourse and dissenting opinions.
Notable Quotes: IT IS A 100% NO FROM ME
This Bill is a dangerous and inappropriate abrogation of a fundamental Human Right that will severely restrict freedom of speech and expression in Australia.
This is not a definition of Democracy. It’s a definition of TOTALITARIANISM.
It is one of the most brazen pieces of legislation I’ve ever seen or heard off in a supposedly Democratic nation.
